com.google.gwt.gears.client.desktop
Class Desktop

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.desktop.Desktop

public final class Desktop
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

The Desktop module provides an interface for accessing desktop related functionality, such as creating shortcuts or selecting files.

Permission

Does not require user permission.

Method Detail

createShortcut

public void createShortcut(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String url,
                           DesktopIcons icons)
Creates a desktop shortcut for launching a web application.

The icon sizes were chosen to meet the needs of a variety of platforms. If an application wants its icons to look as good as possible on all platforms, it should provide all valid sizes.

The shortcut will launch the same web browser that created the shortcut.

The url and icons values can be relative or absolute URLs. Relative URLs are resolved using the caller's location.

Calling this API will trigger a confirmation dialog. The dialog will use the 32x32 icon if it exists, or else the closest size available.

Users can choose to never allow a particular named shortcut for a given origin, in which case the dialog will not be displayed.

Shortcuts created through this API cannot overwrite an existing shortcut with the same name, and such attempts fail silently. This restriction may be relaxed in a future version of Gears.

Any query in the shortcut URL must not contain literal percent symbols, encoded (%25) or otherwise. Any such characters will be stripped from the URL.

Parameters:
name - The user-visible name of the shortcut. It cannot contain any of these characters: "\/:*?<>|
url - The address to launch when the user opens the shortcut. The URL must be in the same origin as the calling page. Note that for technical reasons, on Windows Mobile, any query parameters are stripped from the URL.
icons - An object containing one or more of these named properties: 128x128, 48x48, 32x32, 16x16. The value of each property must be the URL of a PNG-formatted image with dimensions matching the property name. A data URL containing base64-encoded PNG data can also be used.

createShortcut

public void createShortcut(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String url,
                           DesktopIcons icons,
                           java.lang.String description)
Creates a desktop shortcut for launching a web application.

The icon sizes were chosen to meet the needs of a variety of platforms. If an application wants its icons to look as good as possible on all platforms, it should provide all valid sizes.

The shortcut will launch the same web browser that created the shortcut.

The url and icons values can be relative or absolute URLs. Relative URLs are resolved using the caller's location.

Calling this API will trigger a confirmation dialog. The dialog will use the 32x32 icon if it exists, or else the closest size available.

Users can choose to never allow a particular named shortcut for a given origin, in which case the dialog will not be displayed.

Shortcuts created through this API cannot overwrite an existing shortcut with the same name, and such attempts fail silently. This restriction may be relaxed in a future version of Gears.

Any query in the shortcut URL must not contain literal percent symbols, encoded (%25) or otherwise. Any such characters will be stripped from the URL.

Parameters:
name - The user-visible name of the shortcut. It cannot contain any of these characters: "\/:*?<>|
url - The address to launch when the user opens the shortcut. The URL must be in the same origin as the calling page. Note that for technical reasons, on Windows Mobile, any query parameters are stripped from the URL.
icons - An object containing one or more of these named properties: 128x128, 48x48, 32x32, 16x16. The value of each property must be the URL of a PNG-formatted image with dimensions matching the property name. A data URL containing base64-encoded PNG data can also be used.
description - Additional text to display in the confirmation dialog.

extractMetaData

public BlobMetaData extractMetaData(Blob blob)
Calculates metadata (such as MIME type) from a Blob's contents. For example, if the Blob contains image data in a well-known encoding (such as PNG or JPEG), this will return the image's width and height.

Parameters:
blob - The Blob to examine.
Returns:
A BlobMetaData instance.

openFiles

public void openFiles(OpenFilesHandler handler)
Provides user-driven access to files on the client machine. Presents the user with a file selection dialog for choosing files to make available to the application.

Default options are used: all files on the local disk are selectable, and the user may select multiple files

Parameters:
handler - The callback to invoke after the user has selected files

openFiles

public void openFiles(OpenFilesHandler handler,
                      boolean singleFile)
Provides user-driven access to files on the client machine. Presents the user with a file selection dialog for choosing files to make available to the application.

Default options are used: all files on the local disk are selectable, and the user may select multiple files

Parameters:
handler - The handler to receive an event after the user has selected files
singleFile - If true, the user may select only a single file

openFiles

public void openFiles(OpenFilesHandler handler,
                      boolean singleFile,
                      java.lang.String[] filter)
Provides user-driven access to files on the client machine. Presents the user with a file selection dialog for choosing files to make available to the application.

Default options are used: all files on the local disk are selectable, and the user may select multiple files

Parameters:
handler - The handler to receive an event after the user has selected files
singleFile - If true, the user may select only a single file
filter - An array of content types or file extensions to filter by

openFiles

public void openFiles(OpenFilesHandler handler,
                      OpenFilesOptions options)
Provides user-driven access to files on the client machine. Presents the user with a file selection dialog for choosing files to make available to the application.

Only files matching the filter are selectable. The user can turn the filter off, so be aware that selected files may not match the filter.

Parameters:
handler - The handler to receive an event after the user has selected files
options - An instance of OpenFilesOptions to customize the behavior of the operation.

openFiles

public void openFiles(OpenFilesHandler handler,
                      java.lang.String[] filter)
Provides user-driven access to files on the client machine. Presents the user with a file selection dialog for choosing files to make available to the application.

Default options are used: all files on the local disk are selectable, and the user may select multiple files

Parameters:
handler - The handler to receive an event after the user has selected files
filter - An array of content types or file extensions to filter by
